Why You?

Are you an experienced Google Workspace Engineer based in India? Do you want to work remotely? How about joining a one-of-a-kind Google Enterprise Premier Partner and cloud consulting firm? Do you want to work in a customer facing consulting role? Do you have a strong technical background to assist our customers smoothly transition from existing Microsoft Exchange and 365, IBM Domino, and Groupwise platforms to Google Workspace? If you Love Data and enjoy solving complex business problems with technology then this could be the job for you!

What will you be doing?
Act as a true consultant to Pythian’s customers becoming their trusted advisor, to ensure they are using the Google platform efficiently and effectively to meet their needs and to verify it is integrating well with their other tools and processes.
Supporting sales representatives in the technical pre-sales process to demonstrate Google Workspace capabilities to prospective customers of all shapes and sizes from SMB to Enterprise by participating in conference calls, site visits (pandemic permitting), presentations, product demonstrations, technical objection handling and proposals.
Leading technical pre-sales efforts to demonstrate Google Workspace and select ISVs to customers and scoping projects.
Providing subject matter expertise in Google Workspace solutions and leading all technical aspects of post sales activities for transitioning from legacy messaging and collaboration solutions to Google.
Providing subject matter expertise of Chrome and leading all technical aspects of pre and post-sales activities for Chrome Enterprise projects.
Performing hands-on design, configuration and troubleshooting of Google Workspace deployments including successfully migrating data to Google, integrating customer Active Directory environments with Google, and educating customer technical resources.
Interacting with customer technical and project resources in face-to-face and remote interactions.
Leading technical workstreams of deployment planning workshops at customer locations and assisting with accurately scoping Google deployment projects.
Utilizing 3rd party utilities to leverage Google APIs to script bulk changes of Workspace settings.
Acting as the escalation point for technical support resources for advanced Workspace and Chrome issues.
Adapting existing customer messaging and collaboration workflow/processes to the appropriate Google solution.
What do we need from you?
While we realize you might not have everything on the list to be the successful candidate for the Google Workspace Engineer job you will likely have experience in similar roles. The position requires specialized knowledge and experience in performing the following:
Thrive in a customer facing consulting and presales role.
Experience deploying and administering Google Workspace in enterprise environments.
Experience managing or administering Microsoft Exchange or Microsoft 365 in mission-critical business environments.
Knowledge and experience configuring and administering Windows servers and services such as DNS, DHCP, IIS and Group Policies and advanced understanding of Microsoft Active Directory.
Strong working knowledge of networking concepts (e.g. IP, firewalls, NAT, proxy, VLANs, VPN).
Able to quickly adapt to technology and process changes while effectively managing concurrent projects and tasks with minimal oversight.
Proficiency in PowerShell scripting.
Ability to convey complex technical concepts and requirements in a concise and easy to understand manner.
Ability to travel within the United States and Canada (in the future when safe to do so).
Nice to haves;
Google Workspace (formerly G Suite) Certification (Deployment Service Specialist or Professional Collaboration Engineer), Microsoft 365 Certifications or any equivalent certifications would be great.
Experience with creating and managing virtual machines.
A foundational understanding of and experience with Javascript, Python, or other programming languages.
What do you get in return?
Love your career: Competitive total rewards package with an annual bonus
Love your development: Hone your skills or learn new ones with our substantial training allowance; participate in professional development days, attend conferences, become certified, whatever you like!
Love your work/life balance: Why commute? Work remotely from your home (forever), there’s no daily travel requirement to an office! You can be located anywhere in North America, all you need is a stable internet connection.
Love your workspace: We give you all the equipment you need to work from home including a laptop with your choice of OS, and an annual budget to personalize your work environment!
Love your community: Blog during work hours; take a day off and volunteer for your favourite charity.
Why Pythian?

Pythian excels at helping businesses use their data and cloud to transform how they compete and win in this ever-changing environment by delivering advanced on-prem, hybrid, cloud and multi-cloud solutions to solve the toughest data challenges faster and better than anyone else. Founded and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada in 1997, Pythian now has more than 370 employees located around the globe with over 350 clients spanning industries from SaaS; media; gaming; financial services; e-commerce and more. Pythian is known for its technology-enabled data expertise covering everything from ETL to ML. We pride ourselves on our ability to deliver innovative solutions that meet the specific data goals of each client and have built meaningful partnerships with major cloud vendors AWS, Google and Microsoft. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing digital economy. If you are a Workspace Engineer; live in Costa Rica; love your data and want to love your career, then join us!

We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.

Job Summary

Responsible for assisting in the design of system architectures and solutions to bring to market new innovative products which span web service offerings. Assists in the planning, designing, integrating, testing, deploying and supporting of products. Helps with testing and operational activities. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.

Job Description

Core Responsibilities

Develops solutions to a wide range of difficult applications, problems or procedures.
Supports Lead Engineer with the architecture, design, development, qualification and deployment of applications consistent with product and technical roadmaps.
Works with engineering project management and lead engineer to deliver applications that meet or exceed product requirements, project schedules and reliability.
Assists product development and operations teams to define technical requirements to accompany existing products and operation requirements. Designs and develops use cases in support of the technical requirements. Transforms technical requirements into architectures.
Determines resources, technology and course of action to achieve results.
Provides leadership and consultative direction to the organization, department and group.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Employees at all levels are expected to:

Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Job Summary

Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Edits new and existing applications. Implements, testing and debugging defined software components. Documents all development activity. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.

Job Description

Core Responsibilities

Supports the architecture, design, development, qualification and deployment of applications consistent with product and technical roadmaps.
Works with engineering project management and principle engineers to deliver applications that meet or exceed product requirements, project schedules and reliability.
Develops and applies performance and bandwidth models for interactive applications to document network impacts.
Works with the product development and operations teams to define technical requirements to accompany existing product and operation requirements. Designs and develops use cases in support of the technical requirements. Transforms technical requirements into architectures.
Defines and documents a detailed design to meet technical requirements and architecture.
Assists in vendor technical selection and management including input to specifications and vendor evaluation. Interfaces with outside teams in the development of internal and third-party software to support the detailed designs.
Interfaces with Company test teams to validate Company test plans and procedures are representative of fully exercising and validating the product features and capabilities.
Works closely with development, integration and test teams to ensure product quality. Prepares deliverables for trial and market readiness.
Drives the continuous improvement of deployed systems by consistently looking for ways to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
Supports operations by providing deployment and sustained engineering support for all responsible systems and technologies. Diagnoses and resolves escalated field issues.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Employees at all levels are expected to:

Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Responsibilities:

Conduct testing of completed applications, websites, and software to assess user experience
Seek to enhance the user experience by creating seamless navigation through various digital programs and interfaces
Use coding to develop the aesthetics implemented within a website or product, from the layout menus and drop-down options to colors and fonts
Combine interface design concepts with digital design and establish milestones to encourage cooperation and teamwork
Develop overall concepts for improving the user experience within a business webpage or product, ensuring all interactions are intuitive and convenient for customers
Collaborate with back-end web developers and programmers to improve the usability

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in work experience bringing new technologies to market in highly complicated, fast pace business environments:

Excellent JavaScript knowledge and programming experience with ES5/ES6 Solid understanding and development experience in Angular 9+
Experience consuming RESTful Web Services
GitHub as the source code versioning tool and JIRA and Confluence as the management collaboration tools
Extensive programming experience in HTML5, CSS3, SASS or LESS, and Material design
Experience with Typescript, NodeJS
Experience in translating functional/non-functional requirements to system requirements

Job Summary：

This position focuses on to perform assigned test development and verification testing on controls products. This position is located in Chennai, India.

Essential Functions
Individual needs to fairly function independently and report to the project leads/managers.
Create test cases, scenarios, scripts from feature descriptions from JIRA board.
Participate in sprint activities like planning, stand-up meetings.
Develop/create test cases/steps/scenarios based on user stories.
Work on Field reported defects and analyze on root cause.
Drive testing automation, scripting and regression testing utilizing test automation tools
"Execute manual and automated test cases,
Analyze results, report and track defects, verify fixes and perform follow-up work to resolve issues.
Identify key KPIs for product quality
Prepare and present reports and metrics to Management
Debug automated test scripts and evaluate results to determine the source of anomalous results.
Execute test procedures and test scripts as part of formal acceptance test cycles and evaluate results.
Analyze the results of test procedures and test scripts.
Write up test results in the form of change requests to be acted upon by software developers.
Verify fixes to validate final product.
Identify quality assurance process bottleneck and suggest actions for improvement
Knowledge about Bug cycle
Knowledge about Test Management Tools like JIRA, Qmetry, setc.
Qualifications
Must be enrolled in a bachelor's or Master of Science degree program. Computer science or computer engineering degree program or related field is preferred.
Technical Skills
7-10 years of software Testing experience
Knowledge on agile methodologies desired.
Selenium Automation experience is preferred
Ownership experience with a product development activity for distributed team preferred
Ability to effectively communicate both written and orally, with good interpersonal skills.
Familiarity/experience with software test analysis and development desired.
HVAC product knowledge will be an added advantage.

having a good understanding of cloud technologies, deployments, backend end-to-end operations is key for this role.

experience with building products that have significant user base/revenue. robust backend systems running in production and catering to real-world users.
professional engineering experience. applied knowledge of restful api design principles and best practises.
experience building & deploying cloud-based backend systems. operate the backend at low latency, high availability, and quality
foundational understanding of ci/cd pipelines, test automation, multi-variant testing.
experience developing distributed systems and scalable real-time applications
excellent programming skills in node.js, express.js with solid understanding of event driven architecture.
understanding of sql and nosql databases. experience with designing and maintaining scalable databases.
experience with typescript
experience with 3rd party libraries and api integrations. eg. stripe, razorpay, etc
strong problem-solving skills with an understanding of core algorithms & complexity analysis.
solid understanding of operating system fundamentals, networking and concurrency concepts.
working knowledge of linux os; able to quickly write command line or bash scripts.
experience with aws technologies like lambda, api gateway, beanstalk, ecs, ec2 etc
experience with docker, kubernetes.

Career Area

Engineering

Job Description

This role primarily involves engineering drawing checking / quality as per Caterpillar Product & Process Standards (CPPS), also need to perform verification based on Form, Fit and Functional (FFF) requirements. The engineering checks related to Designer’s perspective verification in terms built in quality and preventing part proliferations (avoiding duplicate parts in the system) for various Engine systems, sub-systems and components. Also, this role requires to ensure the design layouts, drawing dimension accuracy, functionally compatible checks and confirm to the Engineering practice & standards.

It requires a strong competency level in product design and manufacturing processes to analyse the interferences, proper clearances, suitable heat treatment, dimension and tolerancing requirements. Also, it requires to provide technical expertise to Design Engineers and Drafting Engineers with respect to CPPS and Form, Fit and Functional requirements. Required to review the engineering print with respect to Design for excellence approaches. Need to a have strong competency in GD&T and stack-up tolerancing. Certified ASME Y14.5 (GDTP) would be an added advantage. Competency in Creo and PLM (TCE) is essential for this role. Need to have good communication skills both verbal and written. Candidates need to have one or more domain expertise in Casting / Sheetmetal / Fabrications – product design and manufacturing experience. Competency in Engine products in the area of design / development / Checking would an added advantage.

BACKGROUND/EXPERIENCE: Requires bachelor’s degree in an accredited Engineering, Computer Science, or Materials Science curriculum plus 3-4 years experience or a masters or doctorate degree. Also requires excellent analytical skills. Must have strong problem solving skills, a good mechanical and/or electrical/electronic aptitude, and good communications skills. This is the second level of engineering assignment in which incumbents have exhibited the ability to begin working independently and have demonstrated ability to apply theory and concept, either through on-the-job experience or advanced degree.

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Ever wondered how Amazon offers the Earth's biggest selection and still manages to offer lower prices every day to our customers? Our consumer business teams work with a massive array of selling partners and business financial performance metrics to expand selection and drive costs lower. Given the rapid growth of our business, this requires our category leaders, financial analysts, account managers, site merchandisers and vendor managers to quickly analyze vendors, merchants, categories and brands, diving deep into data showing business efficiency down to the unit sale level. The technology that enables this has huge visibility and impact and is critical to Amazon's continued profitability and growth.

*Innovation*

We're working on the future. If you are seeking an environment where you can drive innovation. If you want to apply state-of-the-art software technologies to solve real world problems. If you want the satisfaction of providing visible benefit to end-users in an iterative fast paced environment, this is your opportunity. The responsibilities of this role will be key in paving the future of Amazon Consumer and transforming how we do business.

Key job responsibilities
Dive Deep into customer issues, troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving problems across various data/dataset requests
Provide support and resolve the incoming ticket requests from WW users, including extensive troubleshooting data requests.
Ensure compliance per the data policies and security controls
Redshift cluster health maintenance
Develop runbooks, or build tools, used by our team or other Support Engineers or our customers, to aid operations and maintenance
Identify customer pain points, raising concerns with engineering, to implement support improvement opportunities
Track/follow-up project requests with users, engineering teams to closure

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar.
1+ years of development or technical support experience.
Understanding of support processes – SLA, handling tickets, monitoring, processes and metrics. Ability to handle high impact incidents, perform root cause analysis and drive to logical closure.
Experience in Perl/Python/shell scripts and building QuickSight dashboards
Experience working with Redshift and ETL and ability to write intermediate-level SQL queries
Preferred Qualifications
1+ years Professional experience in Data Engineering and Business Intelligence
1+ years in with Advanced SQL (analytical functions), ETL, Data Warehousing.
Experience working with Big Data
Strong knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments and performance tuning
Advanced data analysis skills
Experience in development (as a developer) would be a plus

Position Summary

Senior Engineer – Salesforce

Work You’ll Do:

A Salesforce Senior Engineer in our Assets & Hybrid Business Ventures offering will design & develop products, accelerators, and proofs of concept across the portfolio, that can be leveraged by multiple clients based on a roadmap that aligns with Deloitte’s business strategy, market demand, competitive intelligence and most importantly the common needs of our clients. You will participate in requirements refinement sessions to uncover business, functional, and technological requirements for the asset as well as lead the design & effort estimation of the solution to these requirements. You will create detailed solution & technical architecture diagrams, data models, mockups and process maps. You will contribute to other phases of the asset lifecycle like testing, deployment, engineering tier support etc. You will also play a key role in the packaging of a Managed Packaged solution (as applicable) as well as its upgrade and patching process. You must continually absorb new product and technical capabilities from Salesforce during new product releases and acquisitions and develop/adjust future technical roadmap for assets. As part of the role, you will create Proof of Concepts to validate new ideas or adoption of new technologies/capabilities etc. that can eventually take the form of an accelerator or a product. You will perform code reviews and also actively monitor technical debt and work with the team to ensure they are kept to a minimum. Lastly, you should also provide guidance to junior developers and provide oversight on their task assignments.

About The Team

Our firm is investing in new ways to deliver value to our clients, bringing IP to the market through the use of assets. The Assets & Hybrid Business Ventures offering was established to surface, build, incubate, scale, and maintain new, world-class technology-based assets focused on improving the customer experience. Among our highest-priority assets are those built on the Salesforce.com platform. Through our deep experience implementing Salesforce globally, we’ve built a wealth of technical prowess, strategic vision, and industry insights. We are drawing on these strengths to build a suite of repeatably deployable Salesforce-based products and solutions across a variety of industries. These assets will help us provide even faster time to value and reduced risk throughout our clients’ transformation journeys.

Qualifications

What You'll Bring to the Table

Required:
At least have an active Salesforce Platform Developer I and Developer II certification.
4+ years’ of experience with designing and implementing custom applications on the Salesforce platform.
Experience in designing the Salesforce Object Model, Security Model, SOQL as well as configurating the Salesforce Lightning Experience.
Experience in Salesforce application development using Apex and advanced techniques like Batch Apex, Caching, Callouts etc.
Experience in Salesforce UI development using Visualforce, Lightning Aura and Web Components along with basic web development skills like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience with integrating with the Salesforce platform (inbound/outbound) using the REST/SOAP APIs, MuleSoft, or Data Loader.
Experience in using Salesforce development tools like VS Code, Eclipse, Workbench etc.
Experience in implementing Sales Cloud or Service Cloud as well as have basic understanding of the Salesforce ecosystem including Einstein, Community cloud, Marketing cloud etc.
Strong verbal communication skills, strong work ethic, and a positive attitude.
Experience working in Agile/Scrum environment with remote team members
Experience working with offshore teams
Preferred:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent field.
Experience in Salesforce.com product development including Managed Packages, Patching and Release Versioning process.
Active System Architect certification.
1+ years’ of experience as a team lead for developers.
Experience in implementing Salesforce Einstein capabilities.
Experience in implementing Community Cloud with Lightning Community Builder.
Experience in one or more Salesforce Industry Clouds like Health Cloud, Financial Services Cloud, Vlocity etc.
Experience in creating technical documentation including Data Models, Architecture Diagrams etc.
Ability to juggle many competing priorities/deadlines
Technology literacy and ability to translate between business leaders and technical teams developing assets
Highly collaborative and with the ability to lead by influence
Highly self-motivated, energetic, and passionate team-oriented individual

Job Summary

The full stack developer definition is “someone who can work on both the back-end and front-end of systems.” This means that they can develop fully fledged platforms (with databases, servers and clients) which don’t need other applications to function.

Though we prefer experience as a full stack developer, we still consider resources with expertise and exclusive experience on either front end or back end development with respect to Commerce Cloud skills

Experience - 2.5 - 8 Years.

Key Responsibility

Candidate will be part of the project team and would be responsible for/attending
Develop dynamic enhanced e-commerce web experiences.

Apply technical skills in both front and back-end environment.
Change/adapt code according to specifications.
Take part in peer code review sessions.
Actively participate and contribute to periodical team meetings with other developers, QA, PM and BA.

Job Description

The job holder uses existing and emerging technology platforms to design, develop and document technically detailed applications. S/he writes new complex systems (a grouping of programs involving multiple levels of table dimension and internal sorts that accomplishes a particular new function), designs and codes programs and creates test transactions. S/he also analyzes organizational needs and goals to develop and implement application systems.

Provides application software development services or technical support in situations of moderate complexity. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. Programming well-designed, testable, efficient code.

Analyze, design and develop tests and test-automation suites. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and solutions. Maintain software functionality and currency (technical debt and gain). Actively participate in code reviews. Integrate software components into a fully functional software system. Apply security and privacy principles.

Execute full lifecycle software development. Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures. Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems. Ensure software is updated with latest features. Participate in deployment process following all change controls. Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms.

Provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Active learning engagement. Complete all required mandatory training / policy awareness curricula on time. Use learning tools such as Pluralsight to complete both recommended and aspirational targets set in personal development plans.

Demonstrate team work. Leverage existing products/functionality and promote reuse. Work alongside other engineers on the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices. Collaborate closely with all the other members of the team to take shared responsibility for the overall efforts that the team has committed to. Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, business users, project managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions. Utilize local meetups to gain and share knowledge.

Compiles documentation written by more senior developers of all procedures used in system. Acts as mentor to junior level engineers. Experience in developing front end, web or mobile software development using one or more of the following JavaScript, HTML, CSS, NodeJS, Angular Job holder must have thorough knowledge of company's IT infrastructure and daily operations and understand the impact of planned changes. S/he must have knowledge about the functions and features of modern and traditional structured methods for developing applications. Communications and organization skills; team work skills Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives MODIFIED BASED UPON LOCAL REGULATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required. 10-13 years of experience in software development required; experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus; should have thorough knowledge of the software development cycle S/he must also have experience developing Front-End. Job holder must be knowledgeable about cross-platform interoperability (multiple platforms i.e. NT, Intranet, etc.) , major tools in a toolkit for a specific platform and features of multiple toolkits. S/he must be experienced at resolving hardware, software, and communications malfunctions and understand the business impact of resolving complications..

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Kindle has changed the way books are published, sold, and read across the globe. Independent authors are now able to publish and sell direct to readers through Kindle and print-on-demand offerings, enabling them to reach audiences never before available. Kindle readers are able to download any book in any language in sixty seconds. Come be a part of changing the way the world reads.

The Kindle Ingestion Management Services team is responsible for managing and orchestrating the pipelines for ebook conversion from publisher and author uploaded source content in any format to the device compatible format which gives a rich reading experience for the reader. The team ensures to constantly enhance the systems and pipelines to improve the speed and reliability of book conversion.

Support engineers on the Kindle Ingestion Management Services team are responsible for maintaining, and supporting the systems for ebook pipelines from previewing it online to publishing it on the store for all the languages supported on Kindle. You will closely work with stakeholders, customer service agents and program managers. To support this landscape of technology, tools, customers, devices and geographies we are looking for a passionate, customer focused & results-oriented Support Engineer. You will have an enormous opportunity to work with multiple systems analyzing and identifying the common issues and driving them towards resolution to have a positive impact on customer experience. The role encompasses working with support engineering team that provides production support for multiple products and platforms, engineering development support, code improvements and scripts to resolve operational burden of Support Engineers and Developers.

Some Of The Key Job Functions
Understand high-level technical aspects of existing systems, pipelines and services.
Provide support of incoming tickets, including extensive troubleshooting tasks.
Work on operations and maintenance driven coding projects, primarily in Perl or shell scripts, web technologies, with the potential for Java based projects.
Software deployment support in staging and production environments.
Develop tools to aid operations and maintenance.
System and support status reporting.
Provide product and business metrics support to stakeholders.
Ownership of one or more systems or components
Customer notification and workflow co-ordination and follow-up to maintain service level agreements.

Basic Qualifications
Experience scripting in modern program languages
4+ years of development or technical support experience
Experience in Unix
Experience troubleshooting and debugging technical systems
BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field
1+ years of professional software development experience
Excellent programming skills in object-oriented languages including C, C++, C#, or Java
Strong fundamentals in core Computer Science areas like Data Structures and Algorithms.
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications: -
Proven ability to troubleshoot and identify the root cause of issues.
Ability to effectively capture, store, analyze & present metrics data.
Demonstrated skill and passion for operational excellence by using automation and process improvements.
Ability to retain composure under stressful conditions, communicates effectively with a wide array of individuals and gets the right things done.
Prior experience with UNIX system administration is a plus.

Zelthy is looking for a highly motivated Application Support Engineer to join our team. Zelthy is a fast-growing next-generation Healthcare Platform currently used by top global pharmaceutical companies and health-tech companies across Asia.
Good Product Support is a critical element of high customer satisfaction at Zelthy. We are looking for people who love the job of making customers happy, who love making customers successful, and who can understand the pain of customers. We are looking for someone who can take complete ownership with top-notch customer handling skills with sound technical understanding.
Job Responsibilities:
Taking ownership of customer issues reported and seeing problems through to resolution. Managing tickets and support process till resolution.
Researching, diagnosing, troubleshooting, and identifying solutions to resolve customer issues in using the Zelthy Cloud.
Ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem.
Resolving all customer issues in time-bound manner.
Comply with the SLA for issue resolution.
Onboarding new customers: Providing Admin and User training etc.
Talk clients through a series of actions, either via phone, email, or chat, until they’ve solved a technical issue.
Work closely with technical teams to enhance the quality of existing products. Manage and monitor customers’ expectations.
Help in keeping customers extremely satisfied and thereby contributing to customer retention.
What we are looking for:
L1 or L2 customer support experience - supporting web-based software platforms SaaS
Proven ability to troubleshoot software, understand customer requirements & workflow and resolve more advanced issues working within escalation procedures.
Fair knowledge of API, Webhooks, Connectors. Good to have an understanding of Python.
Operational support experience - ability to capture the user environment during troubleshooting & work towards speedy and accurate resolutions for client issues.
Excellent problem-solving, strong written & verbal communication and documentation skills Obsessed with customer support and delighting the customers.
Contribute to developing technical content and IPs such as knowledge base articles, sample scripts, proof of concept, diagnostic tools.
Technologies we use: Python, Django Rest Framework, Celery, AWS, S3, EC2, RDS, Dynamo DB, Lambda, MySQL, PostgreSQL, React.JS
Benefits & Opportunity:
Ours is a young team of technology enthusiasts with a minimal management structure where almost everyone is actively involved in technical discussions, development, and design activities.
At Zelthy you will also have an opportunity to grow further and take lead in developing the customer support structure, processes, and organization.
About Zelthy
Zelthy Cloud (https://www.zelthy.com/) is a Healthcare Platform that enables healthcare companies to create patient-centric applications in minimum time, code, and cost. The platform is used in 7 countries in Asia and is gaining a strong global acceptance for running and managing patient and health programs.
How customers are using Zelthy -
India's largest oncology patient assistance program managed by a Big Pharma (market cap > 100Bn) end to end on Zelthy including patient onboarding to product tracking
All HIV positive patients in India monitored through a program implemented on Zelthy (more than 1 million patients)
Southeast Asia's leading healthcare company with a presence in more than 12 countries has adopted Zelthy as their core technology backbone for running patient programs
India's largest healthtech company has adopted Zelthy as the core technology powering their patient program CRMs
India's first controlled distribution network for a pharmaceutical product in India implemented launched by an Indian Big Pharma on Zelthy
Founders
Anshuman Chaudhary (B.Tech, IIT Delhi | Ex- PwC)
Kaustubh Chandrabhan (B.Tech, IIT Delhi | Ex-Avendus)

Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.

Job Summary

Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.

Job Description

Core Responsibilities

Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Assists with the software update process for existing applications and roll-outs of software releases.
Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications.
Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Software Development Engineers.
Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements.
Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty.
Displays in-depth knowledge of and ability to apply, process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences.
Displays knowledge of and ability to apply, project management skills.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Employees at all levels are expected to:

Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Required Skills and Experiences:

Familiarity with open source endpoint security technologies such as osquery.
3+ years of hands-on experience with working on opensource projects and tools.
Expert troubleshooting skills Unix/Linux environments, Microsoft Windows and Darwin is a plus.
Experience with Linux command line and server administration.
Experience with API integrations and interactions to automate job functions.
Experience with log analytics/aggregation and hands-on on tools such as databricks, elasticsearch.
Experience with CI/CD - Deployment pipelines, and automated build and configuration tools such as concourse and terraform.

Preferred Skills:

Linux command line and scripting experience in Python, KQL, SQL (Presto) and Bash.
Amazon Web Services like RDS, EC2 and Lambda.
Linux/Unix platform development on an enterprise scale. Server administration and platform maintenance. Ansible & Terraform.
Familiarity with modern methods of network and endpoint attacks and compromise such as MITRE ATT&CK techniques.
Knowledge of regulatory compliance configuration and reporting.
Log correlation and/or SIEM platform experience such as Splunk and ELK.

Job Description:
This position is part of Technical Asset Operations (TAO) – Subsurface and Wells (Geoinformation Management) team delivering advanced services for Geomatics by contributing in the production and management of geoinformation.
The candidate should be able to independently, resourcefully, and creatively research and implement new solutions for effective management of Geo-Information within SSW (Subsurface & Wells).
He/she should support a variety of improvement projects and may be called on to steer projects as needed.
He/she should be able to ensure Data Management activities meets Group Data Quality Standards compliance as they relate to operations

Principal Accountabilities:
Maintain the geodetic integrity of the geospatial data managed by SSW
Manage existing services and ensure delivery as per existing SLAs
Collaborate with the staff and deliver as a cohesive unit
Maintain the global integrity and accountability for SSW data maintenance and assurance processes, controls, performance measures (especially FOD Metrics) and compliance
Assure customer needs are met and benefits are recognized by the business.
Support improvement projects and contribute to process improvement initiatives (e.g. CI) to ensure quality management is a key component and outcomes are sustainable from a quality management perspective.

Requirements:

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Geomatics / Geo-Informatics / Remote Sensing

Experience:
Freshers/1 year of relevant industrial experience and Relevant academic & Project experience in a similar role/organization

Skills:
Knowledge of geodesy especially coordinate reference systems and transformation
Basic understanding of spatial data acquisition techniques
Basic understanding of modelling data
Knowledge of image processing techniques
Working knowledge of a GIS software suite (preferably ESRI Suite) including creating, editing and analyzing data
Working knowledge of a RDBMS (Preferably Oracle and SQL Server)
Awareness of subsurface data types especially wells and seismic data
Self-motivated and demonstrated ability to motivate others to achieve results
Good communications skills
Confidence in delivering accurate data that drives critical business decisions

Description

Calypso Technology and Axiom SL have merged to form a new company, Adenza.





Division Overview

Product & engineering work toward delivering a powerful yet flexible technology platform keeping the needs of the end customer in mind. Our development teams ensure that all the codes are delivered with the highest quality. Product managers are home to technical experts who work together to design and build our software and product roadmap, whereas our QA team is constantly aimed at enhancing the quality of our platform delivery through test methodologies for implementations, upgrades, and migrations.

Team And Role Overview

You will be part of a talented software team that works on software applications in the FinTech domain serving global banks including Tier-1 financial institutions. The position involves the development of Java/Scala applications (front and back end) while building expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing and delivery.

Responsibilities
Designing and developing functionality for applications in Java and Scala
Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle through well-designed, testable, and efficient code
In-depth troubleshooting and bug fixes
Work with Product Management to analyze and understand business requirements
Bring innovative ideas to improve our products, the quality of deliveries, and development processes.

Skills And Requirements
BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject
Proven hands-on Software Development experience
Solid learning skills and willingness to tackle new technologies
Object-Oriented Analysis and design using common design patterns
Java knowledge and experience – an advantage
Knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL, and ORM technologies – an advantage
Scala knowledge and experience – an advantage

More About Us

Our Office:

Adenza's Chennai is located on the 2nd floor of the Seethakathi Business Center. Our location is exceptionally convenient for commuters as a major transportation hub, Bus stop, and Metro Train walkable distance from our office. You will find a wide choice to get all the stuff nearby the office because we are in the center of the city. Once entered the office you can see the golf area which looks awesome, and our common kitchen where we have a play area you can find coffee and tea, and snacks.

Why Apply:

Adenza’s mission to pioneer innovative technology offering efficient, accessible, and transparent, fully integrated solutions is only achievable due to our outstanding workforce. The fusion of deep technical knowledge with the element of human passion, understanding, and energy is what makes Adenza’s employees exceptional. At Adenza, we offer great opportunities to collaborate on challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. As we continue our exciting growth trajectory, we recognize how important investing in the best talent across the globe is. Are you self-driven, innovative, execution-focused, and customer-centric? If yes, we want to invest in you.

Adenza is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). We are dedicated to building and supporting a culture of diverse perspectives and talents as well as inclusivity to support individual growth and superior business results.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Have you always wanted to be a part of something bigger - something that charts a course for

the future? Do you love seeing the result of your work reflected in the world around you? Do

The Alexa Data Services (ADS) organization provides data creation, curation, and analytics

to improve Alexa’s speech recognition and language understanding capabilities.

Title

We are looking for an Lead Member of Technical Staff to join our “Platform Engineering" org, in Chennai. You will be partnering with senior business and product leadership to do great things. You are an excellent communicator with the capability of quickly picking up the complicated technology space. You are a tenacious, but nimble learner, who demonstrates design & engineering excellence.

Significant software engineering skills and computer science experience

About Athenahealth
Our Vision: To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
Our Location: This role will be based in Chennai, India. Our Global Headquarters is located in Watertown, MA, just a few miles from Boston. We have two other India locations in Bengaluru and Pune.
Our Culture: At athenahealth, our employees (or “athenistas”) are committed to making healthcare smarter. Our success is dependent on the diversity, collective spirit, and contributions of our people, clients and partners. We value teamwork and believe that the strength of our team comes from supporting each other and leveraging our specialized skills. If you are looking for company that will enable you to work outside of your comfort zone to transform the healthcare ecosystem, athenahealth is the place for you.
Our Perks: Along with health & financial benefits, our athenistas are offered a variety of perks that promote employee wellbeing such as commuter support, collaborative workspaces and dog-friendly offices - just to name a few.
About Athenahealth

Here’s our vision: To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.

What’s unique about our locations?

From an historic, 19th century arsenal to a converted, landmark power plant, all of athenahealth’s offices were carefully chosen to represent our innovative spirit and promote the most positive and productive work environment for our teams. Our 10 offices across the United States and India — plus numerous remote employees — all work to modernize the healthcare experience, together.

Our Company Culture Might Be Our Best Feature.

We don't take ourselves too seriously. But our work? That’s another story. athenahealth develops and implements products and services that support US healthcare: It’s our chance to create healthier futures for ourselves, for our family and friends, for everyone.

Our vibrant and talented employees — or athenistas, as we call ourselves — spark the innovation and passion needed to accomplish our goal. We continue to expand our workforce with amazing people who bring diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives at every level, and foster an environment where every athenista feels comfortable bringing their best selves to work.

Our size makes a difference, too: We are small enough that your individual contributions will stand out — but large enough to grow your career with our resources and established business stability.

Giving back is integral to our culture. Our athenaGives platform strives to support food security, expand access to high-quality healthcare for all, and support STEM education to develop providers and technologists who will provide access to high-quality healthcare for all in the future. As part of the evolution of athenahealth’s Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program, we’ve selected nonprofit partners that align with our purpose and let us foster long-term partnerships for charitable giving, employee volunteerism, insight sharing, collaboration, and cross-team engagement.

What can we do for you?

Along with health and financial benefits, athenistas enjoy perks specific to each location, including commuter support, employee assistance programs, tuition assistance, employee resource groups, and collaborative workspaces — some offices even welcome dogs.

In addition to our traditional benefits and perks, we sponsor events throughout the year, including book clubs, external speakers, and hackathons. And we provide athenistas with a company culture based on learning, the support of an engaged team, and an inclusive environment where all employees are valued.

We also encourage a better work-life balance for athenistas with our flexibility. While we know in-office collaboration is critical to our vision, we recognize that not all work needs to be done within an office environment, full-time. With consistent communication and digital collaboration tools, athenahealth enables employees to find a balance that feels fulfilling and productive for each individual situation.

IT QA Engineer

Job Summary

Software quality assurance engineer responsible for testing mortgage servicing projects.

Essential Job Functions

The Quality Assurance Engineer, a member of the QA Team within the IT organization, is primarily responsible for the independent testing of mortgage servicing projects. Duties include reviewing business, security, and compliance requirements, creating test plans traceable to those requirements, capturing defects, and providing project-level and executive reporting. This position will require the execution of various testing types such as functionality, error, regression, system, acceptance, and performance. Candidate will also assist with User Acceptance Testing activities as well as post-implementation defect root cause analysis.

FUNCTIONAL JOB COMPETENCIES

Ability To
Review business requirements and technical specifications of current software development projects
Convert business requirements and specifications into a QA test plans, scenarios and test cases
Execute test cases and report progress in a timely and accurate manner
Conduct root cause analysis of identified defects providing Development/Business Analyst partners with enough detail to understand, replicate and prevent future occurrences the defect
Document test defects discovered during the test cycle, communicating to all partners involved
Follow up on outstanding issues to meet testing timelines
Ensure that no defective products are moved to end user testing or production environments without thorough testing
Document new processes and systems as they are tested to help provide training to other team members
Identify opportunities for continuous improvement
EDUCATION
Bachelors degree education
Experience
3 plus years of experience in QA overall
2 plus years experience in manual / functional testing
1 year experience in automation testing , any tool .
SQL - Intermediate experience required
Winium/Selenium experience is a plus
Mortgage experience a plus;
VSTS (or other test tracking software) experience a plus – test cases, bug tracking, test execution
Experience with agile methodologies a plus
WORK TIMINGS
General Shift , Flexible Timings

We strive to weave the principles of diversity and inclusion throughout the fabric of how we work, how we interact, and how we engage with our customers and the community.

Position: Quality Assurance Engineer, Kindle Royalties and Accounting Team
Details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Kindle has changed the way books are published, sold, and read across the globe. Independent authors are now able to publish and sell direct to readers through Kindle and print-on-demand offerings, enabling them to reach audiences never before available. Kindle readers are able to download any book in any language in sixty seconds. Come be a part of changing the way the world reads.

Our Quality Assurance Engineers test code at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. They are not pure black box testers; they are grey box testers able to understand software internals, debug problems using log files, and write automated tests with Perl/Java scripts and/or user-level automated tools. We are looking for a talented, detail, oriented Quality Assurance Engineer who is passionate about quality and enthusiastic about new cutting edge technology.

Our Quality Assurance Engineers work with Software Development Engineers to understand features and technical implementation. They also work with groups such as Product Management, User Interaction, and Customer Support to understand customer usage models and develop test plans and suites that approximate real-world environments and regression tests driving the software development process toward quality-centric methodologies.

Key job responsibilities

Your job responsibilities include but not limited to
Understanding the business of royalties and accounting in Kindle and develop test plans, test strategy, and test cases.
You are responsible for end-to-end product testing from working with PM/TPM to gather requirements, to working with development to thoroughly test, and gather post launch metrics for quality improvement.
You are responsible for identifying automation opportunities and work with SDET to build the right test framework
You are responsible for coordinating manual testing, perform non-functional testing, and execute/lead critical parts of testing.
You will work across other organizations who have similar testing needs. You shall use their tools/methods for our projects and share our best practices to other orgs for implementing.
You help to drive pre-mortem and post-mortem of projects, identify areas of improvement, and feedback to the team for implementing.
You will have an opportunity to work and understand the latest AWS tech and how we build services to solve business problems. You will not be a mere black box tester but rather look into various services that interfaces with each other to perform thorough testing (grey box).
A day in the life

As QAE you will understand the new business models/products in the royalty costing and accounting space to build test strategy, influence development of services with guardrails, and test plans. You work with both business leaders, our development team, and peer development teams to test the features. You identify opportunities for automation, plan, and implement it.

About The Team

The Kindle Royalty and Accounting Engineering team is responsible for providing accurate and timely royalty calculations and accounting entries for all Kindle and print-on-demand book sales. Publishers and authors of all shapes and sizes rely on Amazon to correctly account for all book sales so that they are paid correctly. Timely and accurate payment and reporting improves publisher trust resulting in enhancement of selection for the customers.


Basic Qualifications
1+ year of experience working as a Quality Assurance Engineer
Experience in manual testing
Experience in automation testing
Bachelor's Degree
BS in Computer Science or equivalent combination of technical education and work experience
5+ years of software testing experience
Background in automation using Java, C++ or similar languages is a plus.
Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools
Ability to understand technical specifications and analyze log files
Preferred Qualifications
Comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings
Strong organizational skills, tracking multiple test executions simultaneously and ability to synthesize the results
Experience working and coordinating with distributed worldwide teams preferred
Shows creativity and initiative to improve product test coverage and effectiveness

Your Life @ IBM

Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world’s best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.

The department:

The Core Application Platforms (CAP) department is part of Comcast Cable’s Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with technologies that are broadly used for faster delivery of reliable, performant, and scalable software products. CAP provides application building blocks that are relevant—but not specific—to the types of products delivered to Comcast’s customers. Our software helps run products that serve tens of millions of customers.

As an Engineer IVyou will be a technicalleaderon the team, having an input on how our products are tested & implemented. You will work closely with feature developers and operations staff to deliver high-quality software into production. On our team, leadership is earned and not appointed; your communication and collaboration skills are just as important—if not more important—than your technical skills.

The Project:

Many of Comcast’s products reach our customers using an internally-hosted, asynchronous pub/sub service. This service is called “Elements.”It’sfastandflexible push notification service which supports both individual and fan-out notifications. Your team will be maintaining this existing service andresponding to requests for assistance from internal product owners.

The Team:

We value usable and working solutions now over a perfect solution later

We value diversity of opinion over group consensus

We value being able to pursue a plan together over everyone agreeing that the plan is the best one

We value context and responsibility over management visibility and direction

We start from the assumption that someone, somewhere has already figured out a solution to this problem; we value using their results over rediscovering them ourselves

We value actively and humbly seeking and appreciating honest feedback over preserving our egos

We value making decisions with research and reason over tradition or fear; we are fans of the scientific method

We value building it right over building it fast

Core Responsibilities:

Writing production-quality, tested code
Performing code reviews
Producing technical designs and documentation
Mentoring junior members of the team
Improveservice reliability through effective use of monitoring, alerting, break-fix, blameless post-mortems, and engineering of long-term fixes
Performing DevOps tasks like maintaining our CI/CD pipelines and automated testing
Report status through our ticket tracking system
Effectively prioritize tasks
Collaborate with our technical operations teams to provide outstanding customer service

Preferred Qualifications:

8+ years of relevantsoftware development experience, 3+ of which is in Java
Experience assisting technical collaborators and technical customers
Prior experience leading teams or substantive projects with technical collaborators
UNIX/Linux background: facility with command-line utilities; familiarity with system administration tools and concepts
BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent work experience
Familiarity with distributed systems, asynchronous messaging, and network protocols
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong collaboration skills. Must be able to work in teams.
Experience with container methodologies & orchestration, experience with Kubernetes preferred
Experience with Ansible, Terraform, and other deployment tools
Experience with Scala a plus

Be More at Barclays

At Barclays, each day is about being more – as a professional, and as a person. ‘Be More @ Barclays’ represents our core promise to all current and future employees. Position: Software Development Engineer, Kindle Royalties and Accounting Team
Details:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Kindle has changed the way books are published, sold, and read across the globe. Independent authors are now able to publish and sell direct to readers through Kindle and print-on-demand offerings, enabling them to reach audiences never before available. Kindle readers are able to download any book in any language in sixty seconds. Come be a part of changing the way the world reads.

The Kindle Royalty Costing FinTech team is responsible for building self-service costing management tools that enable the content acquisition teams to directly set costing terms, including ASIN-level terms, to simplify KU enrollment, supporting margin strategy, and to derive insights from historic transactions offering the intelligence to negotiate terms that drive profitability. Publishers and authors of all shapes and sizes rely on Amazon to correctly account for all book sales so that they are paid correctly.

Software development engineers on the Kindle Royalty Costing FinTech team are responsible for implementing, maintaining, and supporting the code for Amazon’s various book royalty systems, including those that power Kindle Unlimited, print-on-demand, and all Kindle purchases across the globe. You will closely work with product managers and business teams to understand the domain and design to meet those and future requirements. You will need to be able to articulate technology choices and decisions to a diverse group and be able to influence them. In all, this role is an exciting mix of solid technical complexity, partnering with the business team, and delivery excellence. You will be ably supported by a team of engineers and there will be leadership growth opportunity to mentor junior engineers.

The ideal candidates will have solid experience in architecture, design & delivery of platforms built preferably on Java and Amazon Web Services technologies. Candidates with proficiency in building data intensive, performant applications or platforms will also be considered. You will be passionate and obsess about providing a premium customer experience.

Key job responsibilities

Work with business, UX, and product teams to define the requirements

Interact with senior developers and principal engineers to review the design, learn, and apply design principals.

Mentor junior members in the team and help them learn and grow their design skills

Own the development end-to-end from requirements phase, to LLD design, coding, testing, and deployment.

You will have the opportunity to experiment on your ideas, develop them, and bring that as a product.

You will be responsible for operational excellence, bring those ideas, and plan them in Sprints.

A day in the life

As a developer, you will be working on the projects at various phases 1) requirements, 2) development, and 3) testing and deployment. In the requirement phase, you will have the opportunity to interact with the business, UX designers, and product owners to conceptualize the product. During development phase, you will own the LLD and coding. You will also learn design principals from senior engineers to grow to the next level. During testing and deployment phase, you work closely with he QA and business stakeholders to ensure the right quality.


Basic Qualifications
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field
1+ years of professional software development experience
Excellent programming skills in object-oriented languages including C, C++, C#, or Java
Strong fundamentals in core Computer Science areas like Data Structures and Algorithms.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with cloud architectures that scale horizontally
Quickly adapt to new development environments and changing business requirements
Create reliable/maintainable code, and find creative and scalable solutions to hard problems
The ability to communicate clearly and concisely both written and orally
A deep appreciation of scalability issues and high volume data handling.

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.

About The Team

This position is responsible for the day-to-day, business-as-usual, support of the Windows, Virtual and Cloud server environments. This includes the installation, configuration, and maintenance of the Windows, Virtual and Cloud environments.

What You Will Be Doing
Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked or Internet-related computer programs. (Code must be used in core version of applications available for sale commercially.)
Interacts with product managers and/or users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications
Participates in software design meetings and analyzes user needs to determine technical requirements
Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements
Trains and communicates with internal Client Training, Client Relationship and Sales teams on systems application
May be responsible for developing or executing project plans, budgets and schedules and for documenting work and results
May deliver informational and decision-seeking presentations to technical and business groups to internal and/or external audiences

What You Bring
3-5 relevant years of experience in Full stack development profile.
Expert knowledge of Microservices Architecture and design, REST APIs, Security, Testing, and deployments in high throughput environments
Advanced knowledge of JavaScript frameworks such as Angular 6+, TypeScript, NodeJS, DJango Framework, Python
Hands-on expertise of common industry frameworks like Django Rest Framework, Pandas, ORM, API Gateways
Experience with Cloud native databases such as SQL

Qualification~ BCA/BSC/BE/ME/B.Tech/M.Tech (Information Technology/ computer)

What We Offer You
A range of benefits designed to help support your lifestyle and wellbeing
A multi-faceted job with a broad spectrum of responsibilities

Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

Role: Test Automation Engineer

Electrical Energy keeps the world moving. No matter where the power comes from or where it needs to go we make sure it makes its way.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Welcome to our world! Join us now.

Our supplier quality engineers help transform design developments into real products. Together with engineering, production, and strategic purchasing, they clarify: is this actually possible? And: which supplier is suitable to manufacture which components? Are you also interested in coordinating, clarifying, and explaining –as an active implementer in an innovative environment? Join our team and expand your own horizon

What Part Will You Play

Create, write and maintain Selenium automation test scripts based upon a defined Test Strategy.
Integration testing of the components developed with other product components.
Definition, maintenance, and execution of manual and automated test cases.
Reporting of test results.
Ensure conformance to organization and project quality processes
What you need to make real what matters!

We need a graduate - B.E./B.Tech in CSE/EEE/Mech with 3 to 5 years of pure Selenium testing experience along with mobile testing.
Experience in Selenium automation framework development.
Good knowledge in Java and OOPS concepts, Mobile Testing
Exposure to functional, performance and load testing.
Should be able to define block box test cases based on use cases and experience in testing large scale systems
Should able to communicate and co-ordinate with distributed team across the world
We’ve got quite a lot to offer. How about you?

This role is based in Chennai. You’ll also get to visit other locations in India and beyond, so you’ll need to go where this journey takes you. In return, you’ll get the chance to work with teams impacting entire cities, countries – and the shape of things to come.

Vestas is the world leader in wind technology and a Defining-force in the development of the wind power industry. Vestas’ core business comprises the development, manufacture, sale, marketing and maintenance of Wind Turbines. Come and Join us at Vestas!

Global Operations Engineering > Remote Operations Centers > Remote Operations Center APAC

Remote Operations Center (ROC) provides real-time remote troubleshooting and operational support to maximize turbine and system availability. We provide required support for external customers, field personnel, and cross-Functional team to resolve technical and operational issues. Our department aims to bring forth technical and operational improvement solutions to optimize turbine performance and lower the cost of energy

Responsibilities
Supervise a team, collaborate, and coordinate with global teams/functions for deliverables with focus on safety, quality, Team work life balance, cost initiatives, stakeholder satisfaction, new project and deployment
Should perform advanced level critical analysis to agile identify and fix quality in operations
Should have good command over data interpretation, wind SCADA/remote monitoring tools, caliber to learn in change environment including proficient operation and use of additional diagnostic tools
Familiarization of SAP front end, data extraction and interpretation and derive, deploy strategy to achieve deliverables
Effectively gather information remotely regarding turbine issues and performance and diagnose, recommend, and implement solutions for turbine Operation
Should conduct quality audits and deploy strategy to improve quality
Effectively promote, direct, and develop an efficient team environment through assisting team members in accomplishing goals. Visibly support and promote team spirit and collaboration
Interface with customer and respond to customer inquiries and be able to support as Functional lead in all key aspects and deliverables
Qualifications
B.E in Mechanical / Electrical/Electronic Engineering or equivalent education
Minimum 10 years in wind industry experience, out of which team leader experience should be minimum 3 Years
Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools Word, Excel, and PPT, SAP data retrieving and information
Competencies
Should demonstrate Team leadership qualities
Wind Turbine Field experience, Remote Operation background to provide end to end support in handling projects is good to have
Remote monitoring Center experience, handling complicate deliverables with the defined framework
Wind Turbine Alarm handling and process nuances
Should possess skilled methodical, quantitative and verbal communication skills
Technical recommendations for wind turbine remote troubleshooting
Team technical competency development and coaching
Extending support to projects related to remote operations center
What We Offer

You'll have the opportunity to assist strengthen the position of Vestas in a key market for the company with good perspectives of growth. Furthermore, this will be your opportunity to use your skills for something greater – together with the rest of Vestas to create a more sustainable future.

Additional Information

The work location is in Chennai, India.

This role require travel, including working a flexible and variable work schedule as needed to meet business needs.

Please note: We do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before 30th July 2022.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.
